intro: Saussurea riederi var. yezoensis, commonly known as the Yezo saussurea, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Japan. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its tall, sparsely branched stem and large, showy composite flowers. The plant typically grows in alpine and subalpine environments, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and covered in fine hairs, adapted to the harsh climate of its habitat. The species is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological significance in its native range.
